column1: Number of deaths involving COVID-19, registered and occurring and those reported on GOV.UK up to 3 April 2020, England and Wales

column2: Daily death counts released on GOV.UK (E&W only)
column3: ONS deaths by date of registration – registered by 3rd April
column4: ONS deaths by actual date of death – registered by 3rd April
column5: ONS deaths by actual date of death – registered by 11th April
column6: ONS deaths by date of registration – (England only) registered by 3rd April
column7: ONS deaths by date of registration – (Wales only) registered by 3rd April
column8: ONS deaths by actual date of death – (England only) registered by 11th April
column9: ONS deaths by actual date of death – (Wales only) registered by 11th April

column1: 3 Figures based on boundaries as of February 2020.

4 Figures for deaths occurring only include deaths that were registered by the date indicated, so may be an underestimate due to registration delays. More information on registration delays for a range of causes can be found on the ONS website via the link below.
Impact of registration delays on mortality statistics in England and Wales: 2018 (latest)

5 DHSC death counts are taken the next day. For example, deaths reported on the 6 March were used for 5th March. These figures are being worked on by DHSC and next week will require better reconciliation.
